section: timers.c C:/Users/ponym/ARHMA2021/Firmware/Main/FreeRTOS/timers.c Go to the documentation of this file.00001 /* 00002 * FreeRTOS Kernel V10.2.0 00003 * Copyright (C) 2019 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved. 00004 * 00005 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of 00006 * this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in 00007 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 00008 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of 00009 * the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, 00010 * subject to the following conditions: 00011 * 00012 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all 00013 * copies or substantial portions of the Software. 00014 * 00015 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 00016 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS 00017 * FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR 00018 * COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER 00019 * IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN 00020 * CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. 00021 * 00022 * http://www.FreeRTOS.org 00023 * http://aws.amazon.com/freertos 00024 * 00025 * 1 tab == 4 spaces! 00026 */ 00027 00028 /* Standard includes. */ 00029 #include <stdlib.h> 00030 00031 /* Defining MPU_WRAPPERS_INCLUDED_FROM_API_FILE prevents task.h from redefining 00032 all the API functions to use the MPU wrappers. That should only be done when 00033 task.h is included from an application file. */ 00034 #define MPU_WRAPPERS_INCLUDED_FROM_API_FILE 00035 00036 #include "FreeRTOS.h" 00037 #include "task.h" 00038 #include "queue.h" 00039 #include "timers.h" 00040 00041 #if ( INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall == 1 ) && ( configUSE_TIMERS == 0 ) 00042 #error configUSE_TIMERS must be set to 1 to make the xTimerPendFunctionCall() function available. 00043 #endif 00044 00045 /* Lint e9021, e961 and e750 are suppressed as a MISRA exception justified 00046 because the MPU ports require MPU_WRAPPERS_INCLUDED_FROM_API_FILE to be defined 00047 for the header files above, but not in this file, in order to generate the 00048 correct privileged Vs unprivileged linkage and placement. */ 00049 #undef MPU_WRAPPERS_INCLUDED_FROM_API_FILE /*lint !e9021 !e961 !e750. */ 00050 00051 00052 /* This entire source file will be skipped if the application is not configured 00053 to include software timer functionality. This #if is closed at the very bottom 00054 of this file. If you want to include software timer functionality then ensure 00055 configUSE_TIMERS is set to 1 in FreeRTOSConfig.h. */ 00056 #if ( configUSE_TIMERS == 1 ) 00057 00058 /* Misc definitions. */ 00059 #define tmrNO_DELAY ( TickType_t ) 0U 00060 00061 /* The name assigned to the timer service task. This can be overridden by 00062 defining trmTIMER_SERVICE_TASK_NAME in FreeRTOSConfig.h. */ 00063 #ifndef configTIMER_SERVICE_TASK_NAME 00064 #define configTIMER_SERVICE_TASK_NAME "Tmr Svc" 00065 #endif 00066 00067 /* Bit definitions used in the ucStatus member of a timer structure. */ 00068 #define tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE ( ( uint8_t ) 0x01 ) 00069 #define tmrSTATUS_IS_STATICALLY_ALLOCATED ( ( uint8_t ) 0x02 ) 00070 #define tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD ( ( uint8_t ) 0x04 ) 00071 00072 /* The definition of the timers themselves. */ 00073 typedef struct tmrTimerControl /* The old naming convention is used to prevent breaking kernel aware debuggers. */ 00074 { 00075 const char *pcTimerName; /*<< Text name. This is not used by the kernel, it is included simply to make debugging easier. */ /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00076 ListItem_t xTimerListItem; /*<< Standard linked list item as used by all kernel features for event management. */ 00077 TickType_t xTimerPeriodInTicks;/*<< How quickly and often the timer expires. */ 00078 void *pvTimerID; /*<< An ID to identify the timer. This allows the timer to be identified when the same callback is used for multiple timers. */ 00079 TimerCallbackFunction_t pxCallbackFunction; /*<< The function that will be called when the timer expires. */ 00080 #if( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 00081 UBaseType_t uxTimerNumber; /*<< An ID assigned by trace tools such as FreeRTOS+Trace */ 00082 #endif 00083 uint8_t ucStatus; /*<< Holds bits to say if the timer was statically allocated or not, and if it is active or not. */ 00084 } xTIMER; 00085 00086 /* The old xTIMER name is maintained above then typedefed to the new Timer_t 00087 name below to enable the use of older kernel aware debuggers. */ 00088 typedef xTIMER Timer_t; 00089 00090 /* The definition of messages that can be sent and received on the timer queue. 00091 Two types of message can be queued - messages that manipulate a software timer, 00092 and messages that request the execution of a non-timer related callback. The 00093 two message types are defined in two separate structures, xTimerParametersType 00094 and xCallbackParametersType respectively. */ 00095 typedef struct tmrTimerParameters 00096 { 00097 TickType_t xMessageValue; /*<< An optional value used by a subset of commands, for example, when changing the period of a timer. */ 00098 Timer_t * pxTimer; /*<< The timer to which the command will be applied. */ 00099 } TimerParameter_t; 00100 00101 00102 typedef struct tmrCallbackParameters 00103 { 00104 PendedFunction_t pxCallbackFunction; /* << The callback function to execute. */ 00105 void *pvParameter1; /* << The value that will be used as the callback functions first parameter. */ 00106 uint32_t ulParameter2; /* << The value that will be used as the callback functions second parameter. */ 00107 } CallbackParameters_t; 00108 00109 /* The structure that contains the two message types, along with an identifier 00110 that is used to determine which message type is valid. */ 00111 typedef struct tmrTimerQueueMessage 00112 { 00113 BaseType_t xMessageID; /*<< The command being sent to the timer service task. */ 00114 union 00115 { 00116 TimerParameter_t xTimerParameters; 00117 00118 /* Don't include xCallbackParameters if it is not going to be used as 00119 it makes the structure (and therefore the timer queue) larger. */ 00120 #if ( INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall == 1 ) 00121 CallbackParameters_t xCallbackParameters; 00122 #endif /* INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall */ 00123 } u; 00124 } DaemonTaskMessage_t; 00125 00126 /*lint -save -e956 A manual analysis and inspection has been used to determine 00127 which static variables must be declared volatile. */ 00128 00129 /* The list in which active timers are stored. Timers are referenced in expire 00130 time order, with the nearest expiry time at the front of the list. Only the 00131 timer service task is allowed to access these lists. 00132 xActiveTimerList1 and xActiveTimerList2 could be at function scope but that 00133 breaks some kernel aware debuggers, and debuggers that reply on removing the 00134 static qualifier. */ 00135 PRIVILEGED_DATA static List_t xActiveTimerList1; 00136 PRIVILEGED_DATA static List_t xActiveTimerList2; 00137 PRIVILEGED_DATA static List_t *pxCurrentTimerList; 00138 PRIVILEGED_DATA static List_t *pxOverflowTimerList; 00139 00140 /* A queue that is used to send commands to the timer service task. */ 00141 PRIVILEGED_DATA static QueueHandle_t xTimerQueue = NULL; 00142 PRIVILEGED_DATA static TaskHandle_t xTimerTaskHandle = NULL; 00143 00144 /*lint -restore */ 00145 00146 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00147 00148 #if( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00149 00150 /* If static allocation is supported then the application must provide the 00151 following callback function - which enables the application to optionally 00152 provide the memory that will be used by the timer task as the task's stack 00153 and TCB. */ 00154 extern void vApplicationGetTimerTaskMemory( StaticTask_t **ppxTimerTaskTCBBuffer, StackType_t **ppxTimerTaskStackBuffer, uint32_t *pulTimerTaskStackSize ); 00155 00156 #endif 00157 00158 /* 00159 * Initialise the infrastructure used by the timer service task if it has not 00160 * been initialised already. 00161 */ 00162 static void prvCheckForValidListAndQueue( void ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00163 00164 /* 00165 * The timer service task (daemon). Timer functionality is controlled by this 00166 * task. Other tasks communicate with the timer service task using the 00167 * xTimerQueue queue. 00168 */ 00169 static portTASK_FUNCTION_PROTO( prvTimerTask, pvParameters ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00170 00171 /* 00172 * Called by the timer service task to interpret and process a command it 00173 * received on the timer queue. 00174 */ 00175 static void prvProcessReceivedCommands( void ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00176 00177 /* 00178 * Insert the timer into either xActiveTimerList1, or xActiveTimerList2, 00179 * depending on if the expire time causes a timer counter overflow. 00180 */ 00181 static BaseType_t prvInsertTimerInActiveList( Timer_t * const pxTimer, const TickType_t xNextExpiryTime, const TickType_t xTimeNow, const TickType_t xCommandTime ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00182 00183 /* 00184 * An active timer has reached its expire time. Reload the timer if it is an 00185 * auto reload timer, then call its callback. 00186 */ 00187 static void prvProcessExpiredTimer( const TickType_t xNextExpireTime, const TickType_t xTimeNow ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00188 00189 /* 00190 * The tick count has overflowed. Switch the timer lists after ensuring the 00191 * current timer list does not still reference some timers. 00192 */ 00193 static void prvSwitchTimerLists( void ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00194 00195 /* 00196 * Obtain the current tick count, setting *pxTimerListsWereSwitched to pdTRUE 00197 * if a tick count overflow occurred since prvSampleTimeNow() was last called. 00198 */ 00199 static TickType_t prvSampleTimeNow( BaseType_t * const pxTimerListsWereSwitched ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00200 00201 /* 00202 * If the timer list contains any active timers then return the expire time of 00203 * the timer that will expire first and set *pxListWasEmpty to false. If the 00204 * timer list does not contain any timers then return 0 and set *pxListWasEmpty 00205 * to pdTRUE. 00206 */ 00207 static TickType_t prvGetNextExpireTime( BaseType_t * const pxListWasEmpty ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00208 00209 /* 00210 * If a timer has expired, process it. Otherwise, block the timer service task 00211 * until either a timer does expire or a command is received. 00212 */ 00213 static void prvProcessTimerOrBlockTask( const TickType_t xNextExpireTime, BaseType_t xListWasEmpty ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00214 00215 /* 00216 * Called after a Timer_t structure has been allocated either statically or 00217 * dynamically to fill in the structure's members. 00218 */ 00219 static void prvInitialiseNewTimer( const char * const pcTimerName, /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00220 const TickType_t xTimerPeriodInTicks, 00221 const UBaseType_t uxAutoReload, 00222 void * const pvTimerID, 00223 TimerCallbackFunction_t pxCallbackFunction, 00224 Timer_t *pxNewTimer ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00225 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00226 00227 BaseType_t xTimerCreateTimerTask( void ) 00228 { 00229 BaseType_t xReturn = pdFAIL; 00230 00231 /* This function is called when the scheduler is started if 00232 configUSE_TIMERS is set to 1. Check that the infrastructure used by the 00233 timer service task has been created/initialised. If timers have already 00234 been created then the initialisation will already have been performed. */ 00235 prvCheckForValidListAndQueue(); 00236 00237 if( xTimerQueue != NULL ) 00238 { 00239 #if( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00240 { 00241 StaticTask_t *pxTimerTaskTCBBuffer = NULL; 00242 StackType_t *pxTimerTaskStackBuffer = NULL; 00243 uint32_t ulTimerTaskStackSize; 00244 00245 vApplicationGetTimerTaskMemory( &pxTimerTaskTCBBuffer, &pxTimerTaskStackBuffer, &ulTimerTaskStackSize ); 00246 xTimerTaskHandle = xTaskCreateStatic( prvTimerTask, 00247 configTIMER_SERVICE_TASK_NAME, 00248 ulTimerTaskStackSize, 00249 NULL, 00250 ( ( UBaseType_t ) configTIMER_TASK_PRIORITY ) | portPRIVILEGE_BIT, 00251 pxTimerTaskStackBuffer, 00252 pxTimerTaskTCBBuffer ); 00253 00254 if( xTimerTaskHandle != NULL ) 00255 { 00256 xReturn = pdPASS; 00257 } 00258 } 00259 #else 00260 { 00261 xReturn = xTaskCreate( prvTimerTask, 00262 configTIMER_SERVICE_TASK_NAME, 00263 configTIMER_TASK_STACK_DEPTH, 00264 NULL, 00265 ( ( UBaseType_t ) configTIMER_TASK_PRIORITY ) | portPRIVILEGE_BIT, 00266 &xTimerTaskHandle ); 00267 } 00268 #endif /* configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION */ 00269 } 00270 else 00271 { 00272 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00273 } 00274 00275 configASSERT( xReturn ); 00276 return xReturn; 00277 } 00278 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00279 00280 #if( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00281 00282 TimerHandle_t xTimerCreate( const char * const pcTimerName, /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00283 const TickType_t xTimerPeriodInTicks, 00284 const UBaseType_t uxAutoReload, 00285 void * const pvTimerID, 00286 TimerCallbackFunction_t pxCallbackFunction ) 00287 { 00288 Timer_t *pxNewTimer; 00289 00290 pxNewTimer = ( Timer_t * ) pvPortMalloc( sizeof( Timer_t ) ); /*lint !e9087 !e9079 All values returned by pvPortMalloc() have at least the alignment required by the MCU's stack, and the first member of Timer_t is always a pointer to the timer's mame. */ 00291 00292 if( pxNewTimer != NULL ) 00293 { 00294 /* Status is thus far zero as the timer is not created statically 00295 and has not been started. The autoreload bit may get set in 00296 prvInitialiseNewTimer. */ 00297 pxNewTimer->ucStatus = 0x00; 00298 prvInitialiseNewTimer( pcTimerName, xTimerPeriodInTicks, uxAutoReload, pvTimerID, pxCallbackFunction, pxNewTimer ); 00299 } 00300 00301 return pxNewTimer; 00302 } 00303 00304 #endif /* configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION */ 00305 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00306 00307 #if( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00308 00309 TimerHandle_t xTimerCreateStatic( const char * const pcTimerName, /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00310 const TickType_t xTimerPeriodInTicks, 00311 const UBaseType_t uxAutoReload, 00312 void * const pvTimerID, 00313 TimerCallbackFunction_t pxCallbackFunction, 00314 StaticTimer_t *pxTimerBuffer ) 00315 { 00316 Timer_t *pxNewTimer; 00317 00318 #if( configASSERT_DEFINED == 1 ) 00319 { 00320 /* Sanity check that the size of the structure used to declare a 00321 variable of type StaticTimer_t equals the size of the real timer 00322 structure. */ 00323 volatile size_t xSize = sizeof( StaticTimer_t ); 00324 configASSERT( xSize == sizeof( Timer_t ) ); 00325 ( void ) xSize; /* Keeps lint quiet when configASSERT() is not defined. */ 00326 } 00327 #endif /* configASSERT_DEFINED */ 00328 00329 /* A pointer to a StaticTimer_t structure MUST be provided, use it. */ 00330 configASSERT( pxTimerBuffer ); 00331 pxNewTimer = ( Timer_t * ) pxTimerBuffer; /*lint !e740 !e9087 StaticTimer_t is a pointer to a Timer_t, so guaranteed to be aligned and sized correctly (checked by an assert()), so this is safe. */ 00332 00333 if( pxNewTimer != NULL ) 00334 { 00335 /* Timers can be created statically or dynamically so note this 00336 timer was created statically in case it is later deleted. The 00337 autoreload bit may get set in prvInitialiseNewTimer(). */ 00338 pxNewTimer->ucStatus = tmrSTATUS_IS_STATICALLY_ALLOCATED; 00339 00340 prvInitialiseNewTimer( pcTimerName, xTimerPeriodInTicks, uxAutoReload, pvTimerID, pxCallbackFunction, pxNewTimer ); 00341 } 00342 00343 return pxNewTimer; 00344 } 00345 00346 #endif /* configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION */ 00347 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00348 00349 static void prvInitialiseNewTimer( const char * const pcTimerName, /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00350 const TickType_t xTimerPeriodInTicks, 00351 const UBaseType_t uxAutoReload, 00352 void * const pvTimerID, 00353 TimerCallbackFunction_t pxCallbackFunction, 00354 Timer_t *pxNewTimer ) 00355 { 00356 /* 0 is not a valid value for xTimerPeriodInTicks. */ 00357 configASSERT( ( xTimerPeriodInTicks > 0 ) ); 00358 00359 if( pxNewTimer != NULL ) 00360 { 00361 /* Ensure the infrastructure used by the timer service task has been 00362 created/initialised. */ 00363 prvCheckForValidListAndQueue(); 00364 00365 /* Initialise the timer structure members using the function 00366 parameters. */ 00367 pxNewTimer->pcTimerName = pcTimerName; 00368 pxNewTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks = xTimerPeriodInTicks; 00369 pxNewTimer->pvTimerID = pvTimerID; 00370 pxNewTimer->pxCallbackFunction = pxCallbackFunction; 00371 vListInitialiseItem( &( pxNewTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00372 if( uxAutoReload != pdFALSE ) 00373 { 00374 pxNewTimer->ucStatus |= tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD; 00375 } 00376 traceTIMER_CREATE( pxNewTimer ); 00377 } 00378 } 00379 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00380 00381 BaseType_t xTimerGenericCommand( TimerHandle_t xTimer, const BaseType_t xCommandID, const TickType_t xOptionalValue, BaseType_t * const pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken, const TickType_t xTicksToWait ) 00382 { 00383 BaseType_t xReturn = pdFAIL; 00384 DaemonTaskMessage_t xMessage; 00385 00386 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00387 00388 /* Send a message to the timer service task to perform a particular action 00389 on a particular timer definition. */ 00390 if( xTimerQueue != NULL ) 00391 { 00392 /* Send a command to the timer service task to start the xTimer timer. */ 00393 xMessage.xMessageID = xCommandID; 00394 xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue = xOptionalValue; 00395 xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.pxTimer = xTimer; 00396 00397 if( xCommandID < tmrFIRST_FROM_ISR_COMMAND ) 00398 { 00399 if( xTaskGetSchedulerState() == taskSCHEDULER_RUNNING ) 00400 { 00401 xReturn = xQueueSendToBack( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, xTicksToWait ); 00402 } 00403 else 00404 { 00405 xReturn = xQueueSendToBack( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, tmrNO_DELAY ); 00406 } 00407 } 00408 else 00409 { 00410 xReturn = xQueueSendToBackFromISR( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ); 00411 } 00412 00413 traceTIMER_COMMAND_SEND( xTimer, xCommandID, xOptionalValue, xReturn ); 00414 } 00415 else 00416 { 00417 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00418 } 00419 00420 return xReturn; 00421 } 00422 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00423 00424 TaskHandle_t xTimerGetTimerDaemonTaskHandle( void ) 00425 { 00426 /* If xTimerGetTimerDaemonTaskHandle() is called before the scheduler has been 00427 started, then xTimerTaskHandle will be NULL. */ 00428 configASSERT( ( xTimerTaskHandle != NULL ) ); 00429 return xTimerTaskHandle; 00430 } 00431 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00432 00433 TickType_t xTimerGetPeriod( TimerHandle_t xTimer ) 00434 { 00435 Timer_t *pxTimer = xTimer; 00436 00437 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00438 return pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks; 00439 } 00440 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00441 00442 void vTimerSetReloadMode( TimerHandle_t xTimer, const UBaseType_t uxAutoReload ) 00443 { 00444 Timer_t * pxTimer = xTimer; 00445 00446 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00447 taskENTER_CRITICAL(); 00448 { 00449 if( uxAutoReload != pdFALSE ) 00450 { 00451 pxTimer->ucStatus |= tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD; 00452 } 00453 else 00454 { 00455 pxTimer->ucStatus &= ~tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD; 00456 } 00457 } 00458 taskEXIT_CRITICAL(); 00459 } 00460 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00461 00462 TickType_t xTimerGetExpiryTime( TimerHandle_t xTimer ) 00463 { 00464 Timer_t * pxTimer = xTimer; 00465 TickType_t xReturn; 00466 00467 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00468 xReturn = listGET_LIST_ITEM_VALUE( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00469 return xReturn; 00470 } 00471 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00472 00473 const char * pcTimerGetName( TimerHandle_t xTimer ) /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00474 { 00475 Timer_t *pxTimer = xTimer; 00476 00477 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00478 return pxTimer->pcTimerName; 00479 } 00480 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00481 00482 static void prvProcessExpiredTimer( const TickType_t xNextExpireTime, const TickType_t xTimeNow ) 00483 { 00484 BaseType_t xResult; 00485 Timer_t * const pxTimer = ( Timer_t * ) listGET_OWNER_OF_HEAD_ENTRY( pxCurrentTimerList ); /*lint !e9087 !e9079 void * is used as this macro is used with tasks and co-routines too. Alignment is known to be fine as the type of the pointer stored and retrieved is the same. */ 00486 00487 /* Remove the timer from the list of active timers. A check has already 00488 been performed to ensure the list is not empty. */ 00489 ( void ) uxListRemove( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00490 traceTIMER_EXPIRED( pxTimer ); 00491 00492 /* If the timer is an auto reload timer then calculate the next 00493 expiry time and re-insert the timer in the list of active timers. */ 00494 if( ( pxTimer->ucStatus & tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD ) != 0 ) 00495 { 00496 /* The timer is inserted into a list using a time relative to anything 00497 other than the current time. It will therefore be inserted into the 00498 correct list relative to the time this task thinks it is now. */ 00499 if( prvInsertTimerInActiveList( pxTimer, ( xNextExpireTime + pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks ), xTimeNow, xNextExpireTime ) != pdFALSE ) 00500 { 00501 /* The timer expired before it was added to the active timer 00502 list. Reload it now. */ 00503 xResult = xTimerGenericCommand( pxTimer, tmrCOMMAND_START_DONT_TRACE, xNextExpireTime, NULL, tmrNO_DELAY ); 00504 configASSERT( xResult ); 00505 ( void ) xResult; 00506 } 00507 else 00508 { 00509 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00510 } 00511 } 00512 else 00513 { 00514 pxTimer->ucStatus &= ~tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00515 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00516 } 00517 00518 /* Call the timer callback. */ 00519 pxTimer->pxCallbackFunction( ( TimerHandle_t ) pxTimer ); 00520 } 00521 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00522 00523 static portTASK_FUNCTION( prvTimerTask, pvParameters ) 00524 { 00525 TickType_t xNextExpireTime; 00526 BaseType_t xListWasEmpty; 00527 00528 /* Just to avoid compiler warnings. */ 00529 ( void ) pvParameters; 00530 00531 #if( configUSE_DAEMON_TASK_STARTUP_HOOK == 1 ) 00532 { 00533 extern void vApplicationDaemonTaskStartupHook( void ); 00534 00535 /* Allow the application writer to execute some code in the context of 00536 this task at the point the task starts executing. This is useful if the 00537 application includes initialisation code that would benefit from 00538 executing after the scheduler has been started. */ 00539 vApplicationDaemonTaskStartupHook(); 00540 } 00541 #endif /* configUSE_DAEMON_TASK_STARTUP_HOOK */ 00542 00543 for( ;; ) 00544 { 00545 /* Query the timers list to see if it contains any timers, and if so, 00546 obtain the time at which the next timer will expire. */ 00547 xNextExpireTime = prvGetNextExpireTime( &xListWasEmpty ); 00548 00549 /* If a timer has expired, process it. Otherwise, block this task 00550 until either a timer does expire, or a command is received. */ 00551 prvProcessTimerOrBlockTask( xNextExpireTime, xListWasEmpty ); 00552 00553 /* Empty the command queue. */ 00554 prvProcessReceivedCommands(); 00555 } 00556 } 00557 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00558 00559 static void prvProcessTimerOrBlockTask( const TickType_t xNextExpireTime, BaseType_t xListWasEmpty ) 00560 { 00561 TickType_t xTimeNow; 00562 BaseType_t xTimerListsWereSwitched; 00563 00564 vTaskSuspendAll(); 00565 { 00566 /* Obtain the time now to make an assessment as to whether the timer 00567 has expired or not. If obtaining the time causes the lists to switch 00568 then don't process this timer as any timers that remained in the list 00569 when the lists were switched will have been processed within the 00570 prvSampleTimeNow() function. */ 00571 xTimeNow = prvSampleTimeNow( &xTimerListsWereSwitched ); 00572 if( xTimerListsWereSwitched == pdFALSE ) 00573 { 00574 /* The tick count has not overflowed, has the timer expired? */ 00575 if( ( xListWasEmpty == pdFALSE ) && ( xNextExpireTime <= xTimeNow ) ) 00576 { 00577 ( void ) xTaskResumeAll(); 00578 prvProcessExpiredTimer( xNextExpireTime, xTimeNow ); 00579 } 00580 else 00581 { 00582 /* The tick count has not overflowed, and the next expire 00583 time has not been reached yet. This task should therefore 00584 block to wait for the next expire time or a command to be 00585 received - whichever comes first. The following line cannot 00586 be reached unless xNextExpireTime > xTimeNow, except in the 00587 case when the current timer list is empty. */ 00588 if( xListWasEmpty != pdFALSE ) 00589 { 00590 /* The current timer list is empty - is the overflow list 00591 also empty? */ 00592 xListWasEmpty = listLIST_IS_EMPTY( pxOverflowTimerList ); 00593 } 00594 00595 vQueueWaitForMessageRestricted( xTimerQueue, ( xNextExpireTime - xTimeNow ), xListWasEmpty ); 00596 00597 if( xTaskResumeAll() == pdFALSE ) 00598 { 00599 /* Yield to wait for either a command to arrive, or the 00600 block time to expire. If a command arrived between the 00601 critical section being exited and this yield then the yield 00602 will not cause the task to block. */ 00603 portYIELD_WITHIN_API(); 00604 } 00605 else 00606 { 00607 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00608 } 00609 } 00610 } 00611 else 00612 { 00613 ( void ) xTaskResumeAll(); 00614 } 00615 } 00616 } 00617 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00618 00619 static TickType_t prvGetNextExpireTime( BaseType_t * const pxListWasEmpty ) 00620 { 00621 TickType_t xNextExpireTime; 00622 00623 /* Timers are listed in expiry time order, with the head of the list 00624 referencing the task that will expire first. Obtain the time at which 00625 the timer with the nearest expiry time will expire. If there are no 00626 active timers then just set the next expire time to 0. That will cause 00627 this task to unblock when the tick count overflows, at which point the 00628 timer lists will be switched and the next expiry time can be 00629 re-assessed. */ 00630 *pxListWasEmpty = listLIST_IS_EMPTY( pxCurrentTimerList ); 00631 if( *pxListWasEmpty == pdFALSE ) 00632 { 00633 xNextExpireTime = listGET_ITEM_VALUE_OF_HEAD_ENTRY( pxCurrentTimerList ); 00634 } 00635 else 00636 { 00637 /* Ensure the task unblocks when the tick count rolls over. */ 00638 xNextExpireTime = ( TickType_t ) 0U; 00639 } 00640 00641 return xNextExpireTime; 00642 } 00643 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00644 00645 static TickType_t prvSampleTimeNow( BaseType_t * const pxTimerListsWereSwitched ) 00646 { 00647 TickType_t xTimeNow; 00648 PRIVILEGED_DATA static TickType_t xLastTime = ( TickType_t ) 0U; /*lint !e956 Variable is only accessible to one task. */ 00649 00650 xTimeNow = xTaskGetTickCount(); 00651 00652 if( xTimeNow < xLastTime ) 00653 { 00654 prvSwitchTimerLists(); 00655 *pxTimerListsWereSwitched = pdTRUE; 00656 } 00657 else 00658 { 00659 *pxTimerListsWereSwitched = pdFALSE; 00660 } 00661 00662 xLastTime = xTimeNow; 00663 00664 return xTimeNow; 00665 } 00666 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00667 00668 static BaseType_t prvInsertTimerInActiveList( Timer_t * const pxTimer, const TickType_t xNextExpiryTime, const TickType_t xTimeNow, const TickType_t xCommandTime ) 00669 { 00670 BaseType_t xProcessTimerNow = pdFALSE; 00671 00672 listSET_LIST_ITEM_VALUE( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ), xNextExpiryTime ); 00673 listSET_LIST_ITEM_OWNER( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ), pxTimer ); 00674 00675 if( xNextExpiryTime <= xTimeNow ) 00676 { 00677 /* Has the expiry time elapsed between the command to start/reset a 00678 timer was issued, and the time the command was processed? */ 00679 if( ( ( TickType_t ) ( xTimeNow - xCommandTime ) ) >= pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks ) /*lint !e961 MISRA exception as the casts are only redundant for some ports. */ 00680 { 00681 /* The time between a command being issued and the command being 00682 processed actually exceeds the timers period. */ 00683 xProcessTimerNow = pdTRUE; 00684 } 00685 else 00686 { 00687 vListInsert( pxOverflowTimerList, &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00688 } 00689 } 00690 else 00691 { 00692 if( ( xTimeNow < xCommandTime ) && ( xNextExpiryTime >= xCommandTime ) ) 00693 { 00694 /* If, since the command was issued, the tick count has overflowed 00695 but the expiry time has not, then the timer must have already passed 00696 its expiry time and should be processed immediately. */ 00697 xProcessTimerNow = pdTRUE; 00698 } 00699 else 00700 { 00701 vListInsert( pxCurrentTimerList, &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00702 } 00703 } 00704 00705 return xProcessTimerNow; 00706 } 00707 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00708 00709 static void prvProcessReceivedCommands( void ) 00710 { 00711 DaemonTaskMessage_t xMessage; 00712 Timer_t *pxTimer; 00713 BaseType_t xTimerListsWereSwitched, xResult; 00714 TickType_t xTimeNow; 00715 00716 while( xQueueReceive( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, tmrNO_DELAY ) != pdFAIL ) /*lint !e603 xMessage does not have to be initialised as it is passed out, not in, and it is not used unless xQueueReceive() returns pdTRUE. */ 00717 { 00718 #if ( INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall == 1 ) 00719 { 00720 /* Negative commands are pended function calls rather than timer 00721 commands. */ 00722 if( xMessage.xMessageID < ( BaseType_t ) 0 ) 00723 { 00724 const CallbackParameters_t * const pxCallback = &( xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters ); 00725 00726 /* The timer uses the xCallbackParameters member to request a 00727 callback be executed. Check the callback is not NULL. */ 00728 configASSERT( pxCallback ); 00729 00730 /* Call the function. */ 00731 pxCallback->pxCallbackFunction( pxCallback->pvParameter1, pxCallback->ulParameter2 ); 00732 } 00733 else 00734 { 00735 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00736 } 00737 } 00738 #endif /* INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall */ 00739 00740 /* Commands that are positive are timer commands rather than pended 00741 function calls. */ 00742 if( xMessage.xMessageID >= ( BaseType_t ) 0 ) 00743 { 00744 /* The messages uses the xTimerParameters member to work on a 00745 software timer. */ 00746 pxTimer = xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.pxTimer; 00747 00748 if( listIS_CONTAINED_WITHIN( NULL, &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ) == pdFALSE ) /*lint !e961. The cast is only redundant when NULL is passed into the macro. */ 00749 { 00750 /* The timer is in a list, remove it. */ 00751 ( void ) uxListRemove( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00752 } 00753 else 00754 { 00755 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00756 } 00757 00758 traceTIMER_COMMAND_RECEIVED( pxTimer, xMessage.xMessageID, xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue ); 00759 00760 /* In this case the xTimerListsWereSwitched parameter is not used, but 00761 it must be present in the function call. prvSampleTimeNow() must be 00762 called after the message is received from xTimerQueue so there is no 00763 possibility of a higher priority task adding a message to the message 00764 queue with a time that is ahead of the timer daemon task (because it 00765 pre-empted the timer daemon task after the xTimeNow value was set). */ 00766 xTimeNow = prvSampleTimeNow( &xTimerListsWereSwitched ); 00767 00768 switch( xMessage.xMessageID ) 00769 { 00770 case tmrCOMMAND_START : 00771 case tmrCOMMAND_START_FROM_ISR : 00772 case tmrCOMMAND_RESET : 00773 case tmrCOMMAND_RESET_FROM_ISR : 00774 case tmrCOMMAND_START_DONT_TRACE : 00775 /* Start or restart a timer. */ 00776 pxTimer->ucStatus |= tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00777 if( prvInsertTimerInActiveList( pxTimer, xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue + pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks, xTimeNow, xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue ) != pdFALSE ) 00778 { 00779 /* The timer expired before it was added to the active 00780 timer list. Process it now. */ 00781 pxTimer->pxCallbackFunction( ( TimerHandle_t ) pxTimer ); 00782 traceTIMER_EXPIRED( pxTimer ); 00783 00784 if( ( pxTimer->ucStatus & tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD ) != 0 ) 00785 { 00786 xResult = xTimerGenericCommand( pxTimer, tmrCOMMAND_START_DONT_TRACE, xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue + pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks, NULL, tmrNO_DELAY ); 00787 configASSERT( xResult ); 00788 ( void ) xResult; 00789 } 00790 else 00791 { 00792 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00793 } 00794 } 00795 else 00796 { 00797 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00798 } 00799 break; 00800 00801 case tmrCOMMAND_STOP : 00802 case tmrCOMMAND_STOP_FROM_ISR : 00803 /* The timer has already been removed from the active list. */ 00804 pxTimer->ucStatus &= ~tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00805 break; 00806 00807 case tmrCOMMAND_CHANGE_PERIOD : 00808 case tmrCOMMAND_CHANGE_PERIOD_FROM_ISR : 00809 pxTimer->ucStatus |= tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00810 pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks = xMessage.u.xTimerParameters.xMessageValue; 00811 configASSERT( ( pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks > 0 ) ); 00812 00813 /* The new period does not really have a reference, and can 00814 be longer or shorter than the old one. The command time is 00815 therefore set to the current time, and as the period cannot 00816 be zero the next expiry time can only be in the future, 00817 meaning (unlike for the xTimerStart() case above) there is 00818 no fail case that needs to be handled here. */ 00819 ( void ) prvInsertTimerInActiveList( pxTimer, ( xTimeNow + pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks ), xTimeNow, xTimeNow ); 00820 break; 00821 00822 case tmrCOMMAND_DELETE : 00823 #if ( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00824 { 00825 /* The timer has already been removed from the active list, 00826 just free up the memory if the memory was dynamically 00827 allocated. */ 00828 if( ( pxTimer->ucStatus & tmrSTATUS_IS_STATICALLY_ALLOCATED ) == ( uint8_t ) 0 ) 00829 { 00830 vPortFree( pxTimer ); 00831 } 00832 else 00833 { 00834 pxTimer->ucStatus &= ~tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00835 } 00836 } 00837 #else 00838 { 00839 /* If dynamic allocation is not enabled, the memory 00840 could not have been dynamically allocated. So there is 00841 no need to free the memory - just mark the timer as 00842 "not active". */ 00843 pxTimer->ucStatus &= ~tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE; 00844 } 00845 #endif /* configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION */ 00846 break; 00847 00848 default : 00849 /* Don't expect to get here. */ 00850 break; 00851 } 00852 } 00853 } 00854 } 00855 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00856 00857 static void prvSwitchTimerLists( void ) 00858 { 00859 TickType_t xNextExpireTime, xReloadTime; 00860 List_t *pxTemp; 00861 Timer_t *pxTimer; 00862 BaseType_t xResult; 00863 00864 /* The tick count has overflowed. The timer lists must be switched. 00865 If there are any timers still referenced from the current timer list 00866 then they must have expired and should be processed before the lists 00867 are switched. */ 00868 while( listLIST_IS_EMPTY( pxCurrentTimerList ) == pdFALSE ) 00869 { 00870 xNextExpireTime = listGET_ITEM_VALUE_OF_HEAD_ENTRY( pxCurrentTimerList ); 00871 00872 /* Remove the timer from the list. */ 00873 pxTimer = ( Timer_t * ) listGET_OWNER_OF_HEAD_ENTRY( pxCurrentTimerList ); /*lint !e9087 !e9079 void * is used as this macro is used with tasks and co-routines too. Alignment is known to be fine as the type of the pointer stored and retrieved is the same. */ 00874 ( void ) uxListRemove( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00875 traceTIMER_EXPIRED( pxTimer ); 00876 00877 /* Execute its callback, then send a command to restart the timer if 00878 it is an auto-reload timer. It cannot be restarted here as the lists 00879 have not yet been switched. */ 00880 pxTimer->pxCallbackFunction( ( TimerHandle_t ) pxTimer ); 00881 00882 if( ( pxTimer->ucStatus & tmrSTATUS_IS_AUTORELOAD ) != 0 ) 00883 { 00884 /* Calculate the reload value, and if the reload value results in 00885 the timer going into the same timer list then it has already expired 00886 and the timer should be re-inserted into the current list so it is 00887 processed again within this loop. Otherwise a command should be sent 00888 to restart the timer to ensure it is only inserted into a list after 00889 the lists have been swapped. */ 00890 xReloadTime = ( xNextExpireTime + pxTimer->xTimerPeriodInTicks ); 00891 if( xReloadTime > xNextExpireTime ) 00892 { 00893 listSET_LIST_ITEM_VALUE( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ), xReloadTime ); 00894 listSET_LIST_ITEM_OWNER( &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ), pxTimer ); 00895 vListInsert( pxCurrentTimerList, &( pxTimer->xTimerListItem ) ); 00896 } 00897 else 00898 { 00899 xResult = xTimerGenericCommand( pxTimer, tmrCOMMAND_START_DONT_TRACE, xNextExpireTime, NULL, tmrNO_DELAY ); 00900 configASSERT( xResult ); 00901 ( void ) xResult; 00902 } 00903 } 00904 else 00905 { 00906 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00907 } 00908 } 00909 00910 pxTemp = pxCurrentTimerList; 00911 pxCurrentTimerList = pxOverflowTimerList; 00912 pxOverflowTimerList = pxTemp; 00913 } 00914 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00915 00916 static void prvCheckForValidListAndQueue( void ) 00917 { 00918 /* Check that the list from which active timers are referenced, and the 00919 queue used to communicate with the timer service, have been 00920 initialised. */ 00921 taskENTER_CRITICAL(); 00922 { 00923 if( xTimerQueue == NULL ) 00924 { 00925 vListInitialise( &xActiveTimerList1 ); 00926 vListInitialise( &xActiveTimerList2 ); 00927 pxCurrentTimerList = &xActiveTimerList1; 00928 pxOverflowTimerList = &xActiveTimerList2; 00929 00930 #if( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) 00931 { 00932 /* The timer queue is allocated statically in case 00933 configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION is 0. */ 00934 static StaticQueue_t xStaticTimerQueue; /*lint !e956 Ok to declare in this manner to prevent additional conditional compilation guards in other locations. */ 00935 static uint8_t ucStaticTimerQueueStorage[ ( size_t ) configTIMER_QUEUE_LENGTH * sizeof( DaemonTaskMessage_t ) ]; /*lint !e956 Ok to declare in this manner to prevent additional conditional compilation guards in other locations. */ 00936 00937 xTimerQueue = xQueueCreateStatic( ( UBaseType_t ) configTIMER_QUEUE_LENGTH, ( UBaseType_t ) sizeof( DaemonTaskMessage_t ), &( ucStaticTimerQueueStorage[ 0 ] ), &xStaticTimerQueue ); 00938 } 00939 #else 00940 { 00941 xTimerQueue = xQueueCreate( ( UBaseType_t ) configTIMER_QUEUE_LENGTH, sizeof( DaemonTaskMessage_t ) ); 00942 } 00943 #endif 00944 00945 #if ( configQUEUE_REGISTRY_SIZE > 0 ) 00946 { 00947 if( xTimerQueue != NULL ) 00948 { 00949 vQueueAddToRegistry( xTimerQueue, "TmrQ" ); 00950 } 00951 else 00952 { 00953 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00954 } 00955 } 00956 #endif /* configQUEUE_REGISTRY_SIZE */ 00957 } 00958 else 00959 { 00960 mtCOVERAGE_TEST_MARKER(); 00961 } 00962 } 00963 taskEXIT_CRITICAL(); 00964 } 00965 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00966 00967 BaseType_t xTimerIsTimerActive( TimerHandle_t xTimer ) 00968 { 00969 BaseType_t xReturn; 00970 Timer_t *pxTimer = xTimer; 00971 00972 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00973 00974 /* Is the timer in the list of active timers? */ 00975 taskENTER_CRITICAL(); 00976 { 00977 if( ( pxTimer->ucStatus & tmrSTATUS_IS_ACTIVE ) == 0 ) 00978 { 00979 xReturn = pdFALSE; 00980 } 00981 else 00982 { 00983 xReturn = pdTRUE; 00984 } 00985 } 00986 taskEXIT_CRITICAL(); 00987 00988 return xReturn; 00989 } /*lint !e818 Can't be pointer to const due to the typedef. */ 00990 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00991 00992 void *pvTimerGetTimerID( const TimerHandle_t xTimer ) 00993 { 00994 Timer_t * const pxTimer = xTimer; 00995 void *pvReturn; 00996 00997 configASSERT( xTimer ); 00998 00999 taskENTER_CRITICAL(); 01000 { 01001 pvReturn = pxTimer->pvTimerID; 01002 } 01003 taskEXIT_CRITICAL(); 01004 01005 return pvReturn; 01006 } 01007 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01008 01009 void vTimerSetTimerID( TimerHandle_t xTimer, void *pvNewID ) 01010 { 01011 Timer_t * const pxTimer = xTimer; 01012 01013 configASSERT( xTimer ); 01014 01015 taskENTER_CRITICAL(); 01016 { 01017 pxTimer->pvTimerID = pvNewID; 01018 } 01019 taskEXIT_CRITICAL(); 01020 } 01021 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01022 01023 #if( INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall == 1 ) 01024 01025 BaseType_t xTimerPendFunctionCallFromISR( PendedFunction_t xFunctionToPend, void *pvParameter1, uint32_t ulParameter2, BaseType_t *pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ) 01026 { 01027 DaemonTaskMessage_t xMessage; 01028 BaseType_t xReturn; 01029 01030 /* Complete the message with the function parameters and post it to the 01031 daemon task. */ 01032 xMessage.xMessageID = tmrCOMMAND_EXECUTE_CALLBACK_FROM_ISR; 01033 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.pxCallbackFunction = xFunctionToPend; 01034 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.pvParameter1 = pvParameter1; 01035 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.ulParameter2 = ulParameter2; 01036 01037 xReturn = xQueueSendFromISR( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, pxHigherPriorityTaskWoken ); 01038 01039 tracePEND_FUNC_CALL_FROM_ISR( xFunctionToPend, pvParameter1, ulParameter2, xReturn ); 01040 01041 return xReturn; 01042 } 01043 01044 #endif /* INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall */ 01045 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01046 01047 #if( INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall == 1 ) 01048 01049 BaseType_t xTimerPendFunctionCall( PendedFunction_t xFunctionToPend, void *pvParameter1, uint32_t ulParameter2, TickType_t xTicksToWait ) 01050 { 01051 DaemonTaskMessage_t xMessage; 01052 BaseType_t xReturn; 01053 01054 /* This function can only be called after a timer has been created or 01055 after the scheduler has been started because, until then, the timer 01056 queue does not exist. */ 01057 configASSERT( xTimerQueue ); 01058 01059 /* Complete the message with the function parameters and post it to the 01060 daemon task. */ 01061 xMessage.xMessageID = tmrCOMMAND_EXECUTE_CALLBACK; 01062 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.pxCallbackFunction = xFunctionToPend; 01063 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.pvParameter1 = pvParameter1; 01064 xMessage.u.xCallbackParameters.ulParameter2 = ulParameter2; 01065 01066 xReturn = xQueueSendToBack( xTimerQueue, &xMessage, xTicksToWait ); 01067 01068 tracePEND_FUNC_CALL( xFunctionToPend, pvParameter1, ulParameter2, xReturn ); 01069 01070 return xReturn; 01071 } 01072 01073 #endif /* INCLUDE_xTimerPendFunctionCall */ 01074 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01075 01076 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01077 01078 UBaseType_t uxTimerGetTimerNumber( TimerHandle_t xTimer ) 01079 { 01080 return ( ( Timer_t * ) xTimer )->uxTimerNumber; 01081 } 01082 01083 #endif /* configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY */ 01084 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01085 01086 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01087 01088 void vTimerSetTimerNumber( TimerHandle_t xTimer, UBaseType_t uxTimerNumber ) 01089 { 01090 ( ( Timer_t * ) xTimer )->uxTimerNumber = uxTimerNumber; 01091 } 01092 01093 #endif /* configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY */ 01094 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 01095 01096 /* This entire source file will be skipped if the application is not configured 01097 to include software timer functionality. If you want to include software timer 01098 functionality then ensure configUSE_TIMERS is set to 1 in FreeRTOSConfig.h. */ 01099 #endif /* configUSE_TIMERS == 1 */ 01100 01101 01102
